summary: DOD researchers found that about 24% of military servicemembers who died in combat from 2001-2011 could have survived if better and more timely trauma care had been available. To help reduce preventable deaths and disabilities, DOD is planning for a new trauma care system. However, we found that DOD's planning documents do not fully incorporate certain practices, like clear goals and strategies, that could help...
title: New Trauma Care System: DOD Should Fully Incorporate Leading Practices into Its Planning for Effective Implementation
